intro: Halimodendron, commonly known as the desert broom, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae. These shrubs are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. They are characterized by their small, compound leaves and yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring. Halimodendron species are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Their deep root systems help them access underground moisture, making them resilient to drought.
